Structs/ControlForm.html#/s:vP18FormVali.name: entries
Structs/ControlForm.html#/s:vP18FormVali.abstract: Convenience implementation of Form that is a form full of any type of ValidatorControl.

Structs/ControlForm.html#/s:FP18FormVali.name: init()
Structs/ControlForm.html#/s:FP18FormVali.abstract: Convenience implementation of Form that is a form full of any type of ValidatorControl.

Structs/PasswordStrengthConfiguration.ht.name: requiredStrength
Structs/PasswordStrengthConfiguration.ht.abstract: Minimum strength required to be considered valid.

Structs/CreditCardType.html#/s:vPs16RawR.name: rawValue
Structs/CreditCardType.html#/s:vPs16RawR.abstract: Credit card types that are supported by CreditCardCondition. There is a regex property that returns the regex for validating that credit card number.

Structs/CreditCardType.html#/s:FPs9Optio.name: init(rawValue:)
Structs/CreditCardType.html#/s:FPs9Optio.abstract: Credit card types that are supported by CreditCardCondition. There is a regex property that returns the regex for validating that credit card number.

Structs/CreditCardType.html#/s:vV18FormV.name: description
Structs/CreditCardType.html#/s:vV18FormV.abstract: Literal description for set of credit cards, separated with commas and single space.

Structs/CreditCardType.html#/s:vV18FormV.name: regex
Structs/CreditCardType.html#/s:vV18FormV.abstract: Combined regular expression string for set of credit cards.

Structs/AlphanumericConfiguration.html#/.name: allowsUnicode
Structs/AlphanumericConfiguration.html#/.abstract: Whether or not to allow Unicode letters and numbers. If false then only ASCII letters (A-Z, a-z, 0-9) are allowed.

Structs/FormEntry.html#/s:vV18FormValida.name: validatable
Structs/FormEntry.html#/s:vV18FormValida.abstract: A Validatable that contains text to be validated.

Structs/FormEntry.html#/s:vV18FormValida.name: validator
Structs/FormEntry.html#/s:vV18FormValida.abstract: A Validator to use to validate text from validatable.

Structs/FormEntry.html#/s:FV18FormValida.name: checkConditions()
Structs/FormEntry.html#/s:FV18FormValida.abstract: Checks the text from validatable using validator from FormEntry (NOT the validator from validatable).

Structs/AlphabeticConfiguration.html#/s:.name: allowsUnicode
Structs/AlphabeticConfiguration.html#/s:.abstract: Whether or not to allow Unicode letters. If false then only ASCII letters (A-Z, a-z) are allowed.

Structs/CreditCardValidator.html#/s:FV18.name: validCardTypes(for:completion:)
Structs/CreditCardValidator.html#/s:FV18.abstract: Returns valid card types for a credit card number asynchronously.

Structs/CreditCardCondition.html#/s:FV18.name: check(_:)
Structs/CreditCardCondition.html#/s:FV18.abstract: Checks if the string is a valid credit card number, after removes all whitespace.

Structs/NumericConfiguration.html#/s:vV1.name: allowsUnicode
Structs/NumericConfiguration.html#/s:vV1.abstract: Whether or not to allow Unicode numbers. If false then only ASCII numbers (0-9) are allowed.

Structs/PresentValidator.html.name: PresentValidator
Structs/PresentValidator.html.abstract: The PresentValidator contains an PresentCondition. A valid string is a non-empty string.

Structs/NumericValidator.html.name: NumericValidator
Structs/NumericValidator.html.abstract: The NumericValidator contains an NumericCondition. A valid string only contains numbers.

Structs/OrCondition.html.name: OrCondition
Structs/OrCondition.html.abstract: A condition that returns the result of either operands.

Structs/CreditCardCondition.html.name: CreditCardCondition
Structs/CreditCardCondition.html.abstract: The CreditCardCondition checks a string for a credit card number.

Structs/PostcodeCondition.html.name: PostcodeCondition
Structs/PostcodeCondition.html.abstract: The PostcodeCondition checks a string for a post code.

Structs/EmailCondition.html.name: EmailCondition
Structs/EmailCondition.html.abstract: The EmailCondition checks a string for an email.

Structs/RangeCondition.html.name: RangeCondition
Structs/RangeCondition.html.abstract: The RangeCondition validates the length of a string.

Structs/AlphanumericCondition.html.name: AlphanumericCondition
Structs/AlphanumericCondition.html.abstract: The AlphanumericCondition checks a string for occurrences of letters and/or numbers.

Structs/CreditCardValidator.html.name: CreditCardValidator
Structs/CreditCardValidator.html.abstract: The CreditCardValidator contains an CreditCardCondition. A valid string is a credit card number.

Structs/PasswordStrengthValidator.html.name: PasswordStrengthValidator
Structs/PasswordStrengthValidator.html.abstract: The PasswordStrengthValidator contains an PasswordStrengthCondition. A valid string meets the required strength level.

Structs/EmailValidator.html.name: EmailValidator
Structs/EmailValidator.html.abstract: The EmailValidator contains an EmailCondition. A valid string is an email address.

Structs/NotCondition.html.name: NotCondition
Structs/NotCondition.html.abstract: A condition that returns the opposite of the original condition.

Structs/URLShorthandCondition.html.name: URLShorthandCondition
Structs/URLShorthandCondition.html.abstract: The URLShorthandCondition checks a string for a valid URL.

Structs/CompositeValidator.html.name: CompositeValidator
Structs/CompositeValidator.html.abstract: The CompositeValidator concatenates all of the conditions of the individual validators. All conditions must be satisfied for a string to be valid.

Structs/URLValidator.html.name: URLValidator
Structs/URLValidator.html.abstract: The URLValidator contains an URLCondition. A valid string is a full URL with scheme.

Structs/PresentCondition.html.name: PresentCondition
Structs/PresentCondition.html.abstract: The PresentCondition checks for the presence of a string.

Structs/AlphabeticValidator.html.name: AlphabeticValidator
Structs/AlphabeticValidator.html.abstract: The AlphabeticValidator contains an AlphabeticCondition. A valid string only contains letters.

Structs/PostcodeValidator.html.name: PostcodeValidator
Structs/PostcodeValidator.html.abstract: The PostcodeValidator contains an PostcodeCondition. A valid string is a postcode.

Structs/AlphabeticCondition.html.name: AlphabeticCondition
Structs/AlphabeticCondition.html.abstract: The AlphabeticCondition checks a string for occurrences of letters.

Structs/CreditCardType.html.name: CreditCardType
Structs/CreditCardType.html.abstract: Credit card types that are supported by CreditCardCondition. There is a regex property that returns the regex for validating that credit card number.

Structs/URLShorthandValidator.html.name: URLShorthandValidator
Structs/URLShorthandValidator.html.abstract: The URLShorthandValidator contains an URLShorthandCondition. A valid string is a URL, with or without scheme.

Structs/URLCondition.html.name: URLCondition
Structs/URLCondition.html.abstract: The URLCondition checks a string for a valid URL.

Structs/RangeValidator.html.name: RangeValidator
Structs/RangeValidator.html.abstract: The RangeValidator contains an RangeCondition. A valid string meets the required string length.

Structs/ControlForm.html.name: ControlForm
Structs/ControlForm.html.abstract: Convenience implementation of Form that is a form full of any type of ValidatorControl.

Structs/AlphanumericValidator.html.name: AlphanumericValidator
Structs/AlphanumericValidator.html.abstract: The AlphanumericValidator contains an AlphanumericCondition. A valid string only contains letters and/or numbers.

Structs/PasswordStrengthCondition.html.name: PasswordStrengthCondition
Structs/PasswordStrengthCondition.html.abstract: The PasswordStrengthCondition checks for the strength of a password string.

Structs/AndCondition.html.name: AndCondition
Structs/AndCondition.html.abstract: A condition that returns the result of either operands.

Protocols/Form.html#/s:vP18FormValidator.name: isValid
Protocols/Form.html#/s:vP18FormValidator.abstract: Whether or not the entire form is valid.

Protocols/Form.html#/s:FP18FormValidator.name: init(validatables:)
Protocols/Form.html#/s:FP18FormValidator.abstract: Creates a Form where each Validatable uses its own Validator for validation.

Protocols/Form.html#/s:FP18FormValidator.name: init(validatables:validators:)
Protocols/Form.html#/s:FP18FormValidator.abstract: Creates a Form where each Validatable uses a custom Validator for validation. If validatables and validators have a different number of elements then returns nil.

Protocols/Form.html#/s:FP18FormValidator.name: checkConditions()
Protocols/Form.html#/s:FP18FormValidator.abstract: Checks the text from each entry in entries.

Protocols/Condition.html#/s:vP18FormVali.name: localizedViolationString
Protocols/Condition.html#/s:vP18FormVali.abstract: Localized string which described the kind of violation.

Protocols/Condition.html#/s:vP18FormVali.name: regex
Protocols/Condition.html#/s:vP18FormVali.abstract: A regular expression string which the validated string is matched against.

Protocols/Condition.html#/s:vP18FormVali.name: shouldAllowViolation
Protocols/Condition.html#/s:vP18FormVali.abstract: If set to false the user is not able to enter characters which would break the condition.

Protocols/Condition.html#/s:FP18FormVali.name: init()
Protocols/Condition.html#/s:FP18FormVali.abstract: Initializer that creates a condition based on default values.

Protocols/ConfigurableCondition.html#/s:.name: init(configuration:)
Protocols/ConfigurableCondition.html#/s:.abstract: Initializes a new ConfigurableCondition with a given configuration.

Protocols/Validator.html#/s:FP18FormVali.name: init()
Protocols/Validator.html#/s:FP18FormVali.abstract: Initializer that creates a condition based on default values.

Protocols/ConfigurableValidator.html#/s:.name: init(configuration:)
Protocols/ConfigurableValidator.html#/s:.abstract: Initializes a new ConfigurableValidator with a given configuration.

Protocols/ConfigurableValidator.html.name: ConfigurableValidator
Protocols/ConfigurableValidator.html.abstract: A special type of Validator that allows configuration.

Protocols/Validator.html.name: Validator
Protocols/Validator.html.abstract: Validator is a holder for conditions of type Condition.

Protocols/ConfigurableCondition.html.name: ConfigurableCondition
Protocols/ConfigurableCondition.html.abstract: A special type of Condition that allows configuration.

Protocols/Condition.html.name: Condition
Protocols/Condition.html.abstract: A Condition is the smallest sub element of the validation framework.

Protocols/Form.html.name: Form
Protocols/Form.html.abstract: A form to assist in validating ValidatorControl objects’ current states.

Enums/PostcodeCountries.html#/s:vO18Form.name: regex
Enums/PostcodeCountries.html#/s:vO18Form.abstract: The regex for validating the country’s postcode.

Enums/PostcodeCountries.html.name: PostcodeCountries
Enums/PostcodeCountries.html.abstract: Countries that are supported by PostcodeCondition. Each postcode is an ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code. There is a regex property that returns the regex for validating that country’s postcode.

Enums/PasswordStrength.html.name: PasswordStrength
Enums/PasswordStrength.html.abstract: The strength required for the password. The strength is measured on five simple criteria - lower case characters, upper case characters, numeric characters, special characters, and is more than 8 characters long. Each of these matched criteria moves the password strength of the string up one strength. Not having 8 character minimum reduces the string by one strength level.

Classes/ValidatorTextView.html#/s:FC18Fo.name: setValidatorDelegate(_:)
Classes/ValidatorTextView.html#/s:FC18Fo.abstract: Sets the validatorDelegate for the text view. This allows custom responses to both UITextViewDelegate callbacks as well as those from ValidatorControlDelegate.

Classes/ValidatorTextField.html#/s:FC18F.name: setValidatorDelegate(_:)
Classes/ValidatorTextField.html#/s:FC18F.abstract: Sets the validatorDelegate for the text field. This allows custom responses to both UITextFieldDelegate callbacks as well as those from ValidatorControlDelegate.
